medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe epigastric abdominal pain following dinner.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient has had abdominal pain different from her usual flares for the past 3 months. Last night, 6 hours after dinner, she developed severe epigastric abdominal pain and back discomfort. No emesis, and her ostomy is functional.

chronic_conditions: Osteomyelitis of the distal right femur
past_surgeries: Transverse colostomy for pelvic abscesses and small bowel obstruction
Lysis of adhesions complicated by wound infection and enterocutaneous fistula
Exploratory laparotomy and lysis of adhesions with take down of enterocutaneous fistula
Synovectomy and debridement of right distal femur
Exploratory laparotomy and take down of enterovesicular cutaneous fistula
Incision and drainage of intraabdominal abscess
Laparotomy and lysis of adhesions and excision on enterocutaneous and enterovesicular fistulas
Exploratory laparotomy take down of enterocutaneous fistula and small bowel resection

family_history.father: Died of heart problems and TIAs in his early life
